DataElement.preferredName: Hormone Therapy 5 Alpha-Reductase Inhibitor Prior Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a 5 alpha-reductase inhibitor was administered as a prior hormone therapy agent.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hormone Therapy 5 Alpha-Reductase Inhibitor Prior Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a 5 alpha-reductase inhibitor, an enzyme that metabolizes testosterone to dihydrotestosterone and can reduce prostate size, administered as a prior hormone therapy agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy. The concept covers but not limited to: intermittent or permanent hormone suppression or ablation in treatment of hormone-dependent tumors, hormone replacement therapy of any kind, hormonal component of gender reassignment therapy, hormonal contraception, surgical and radiation castration.

Concepts.definition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

Property.preferredDefinition: Substances that inhibit 5-alpha-Reductase, an enzyme that metabolizes testosterone to dihydrotestosterone, and can reduce prostate size.:Earlier in time or order.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits steroid 5-alpha-reductase, an enzyme that converts testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT). Since DHT has three times greater affinity for androgen receptors than testosterone, inhibition of 5-alpha-reductase results in a strong reduction in the androgenic effects of testosterone.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
